image.altText: A trench containing the bodies of pigs and plastic waste.

props.synopsis: Footage taken at four South Australian piggeries shows animals confined in sow stalls and evidence of potential cannibalism.

title.children: Mass grave filmed at SA piggery tied to animal welfare investigation

image.altText: Man in grey hoodie and grey beanie holds box of groceries

props.synopsis: A year after opening its doors, OzHarvest's first free supermarket in Adelaide says demand for food relief is greater than ever.

title.children: OzHarvest says more people seeking food relief amid cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: Josh Rachele holds his arms out and yells in celebration

props.synopsis: The Crows have received a major boost ahead of their knockout semifinal against the Hawks, with livewire forward Josh Rachele recalled after a knee injury.

title.children: Crows livewire returns from injury for knockout semi against Hawks

image.altText: Woman stands straightening younger woman's hair who sits in chair infront of mirror.

props.synopsis: The "salon" is an op shop and the round-trip commute's a doozy, but Juliann Mutch is happy to go the extra distance to pamper her grateful Wilcannia clientele.

title.children: Outback hairdresser drives 1,000km just to 'spoil' her clients

image.altText: Courtroom sketch of a man with a bald head and a beard looking sad

props.synopsis: The trial against a South Australian man accused of murder has been vacated after a jury member allegedly googled information, a court has heard.

title.children: Mistrial declared in alleged murder case after juror googled information, court hears

image.altText: An elderly man sips on a drink with a straw in front of more than a dozen cupcakes.

props.synopsis: States and territories will use a health ministers' meeting today to call on the federal government to do more to address what they say is a critical aged care crisis affecting hospitals around the nation.

title.children: 'A tragedy': 2,500 elderly patients stuck in hospital waiting for aged care

image.altText: A bald man, smiling, in a chequered shirt.

props.synopsis: A small community on South Australia's Lower Eyre Peninsula pays tribute to Jarred Wait, who died in an agricultural plane crash at Cummins.

title.children: Community mourns young father after fatal Eyre Peninsula plane crash

image.altText: Aerial view of the bubble curtain showing an area of ocean with a white bubble ring

props.synopsis: A "bubble curtain" is set for activation as part of South Australia's fight against the ongoing algal bloom, as the state government defends its handling of health advice.

title.children: 'Bubble curtain' ready for use as SA's algal bloom persists

image.altText: Britain's King Charles III with SA Premier Peter Malinauskas.

props.synopsis: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas meets with the sovereign on an official visit to the United Kingdom, during which he also signs an agreement with nuclear reactor manufacturer Rolls-Royce regarding the AUKUS submarine agreement.

title.children: King Charles hosts SA premier, who 'would love' royal visit at climate summit

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: A driver will face court charged over the deaths of two men in a ute rollover on KI on Wednesday night. In a separate incident in SA's far north, a pedestrian suffered life-threatening injuries when she was hit by a bus on the Stuart Highway.

title.children: Driver charged after two men killed in Kangaroo Island ute rollover

image.altText: A woman and a teenage boy each holding a mug while sitting on a couch with a kitchen in the background

props.synopsis: A South Australian mother of a teenager with asthma says it was "irresponsible" of health authorities not to communicate updated advice more widely, amid the state's harmful algal bloom.

title.children: SA mum slams health authorities for 'irresponsible' handling of algal bloom advice

image.altText: Three people in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: Residents in a South Australian town will go to the polls to decide if the larger local supermarkets can open Sundays and public holidays.

title.children: Country town to vote on allowing big supermarkets to open Sundays

image.altText: A dry outback racecourse, with barriers looping the track, and mountains in the backdrop.

props.synopsis: In SA's Flinders Ranges ovals, golf courses and race tracks help people forget about drought for a brief time, even when they are also dry.

title.children: Dry and dusty sports clubs offer solace to drought-stricken towns

image.altText: The remains of dozens of trees lay on the ground as a sign warns people the area is restricted

props.synopsis: An exotic pest that kills pine trees and can be spread by humans has felled nearly 1,400 trees in Adelaide.

title.children: Pine tree pest threatens $3b forestry industry as more SA trees in danger

image.altText: A mother and son stand side by side and smile at the camera

props.synopsis: The SA government says 473 children have been treated at the Women's and Children's Hospital since 2023, for road trauma related injuries. For Kai Archer, the injuries he sustained in an accident two years ago are still having an impact.

title.children: 'Don't take risks': Kai is among hundreds of young people impacted by road trauma in SA

image.altText: Peter Mandelson and Keir Starmer walking down a hallway smiling

props.synopsis: After dogging the US president for months, evidence of a connection to Jeffrey Epstein has claimed a senior scalp within the British government.

title.children: How the Jeffrey Epstein saga spread to British politics

image.altText: An Aldi shopping cart

props.synopsis: Online shopping scams are now one of the most frequently reported scam types and experts say they are alarmingly common, impersonating well-known brands and being promoted in search engine advertisements.

title.children: More Australian consumers are falling for mimic shopping websites

image.altText: A child's hands holding a red capsicum wrapped in plastic.

props.synopsis: Industry is cautiously moving ahead with a new soft plastic recycling system in the wake of the REDcycle disaster. How will it work, and can we really have a circular soft plastic system in Australia?

title.children: Supermarkets are collecting soft plastics again, as recycling trial expands

image.altText: A man in a suit sits on a leather lounge, looking professional.

props.synopsis: Community leaders say the government must consider social and legal reforms to address a spike in Islamophobic incidents.

title.children: Muslim groups welcome Islamophobia report amid harassment spike

image.altText: vogel gfx

props.synopsis: The man in charge of the Northern Territory government's handling of a major methane leak at a Santos gas plant was working with a lobbyist for the project's co-owner.

title.children: Regulator in gas leak 'scandal' had paid role with industry lobbyist

image.altText: Mariah Carey performs between two black male dancers.

props.synopsis: A lot happened this week. Have you been paying attention?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A lunar eclipse, the VMAs and a new richest person

image.altText: Smiling Pooja sits in front of a beach box painted in the Australian flag, among row of boxes on the beach. Wears tee, tights.

props.synopsis: Nearly two weeks after the "March for Australia" rallies, the Indian Australian community continues to grapple with the political targeting of the diaspora.

title.children: Indian Australians say anti-immigration rhetoric is hurting community

image.altText: A profile view of a man wearing a black baseball cap and orange hi-vis vest

props.synopsis: The trial for Lamar Ahchee, who is accused of being involved in drug smuggling in Bali, is underway.

title.children: Australian man faces trial in Bali over drug charges that risk death penalty

image.altText: Yuval Raphael wearing a black fitted suit with long tassels hanging from arms, arms out, holding mic, singing on stage

props.synopsis: Irish national broadcaster RTE has said Ireland will not participate in Eurovision 2026 if Israel does, citing the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza.

title.children: Ireland threatens Eurovision boycott if Israel takes part

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: A criminology researcher says rewards do work as a way of catching people, even if the success rate appears low.

title.children: Former police say rewards can work as $1m offered in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Secretary-General of the OECD and former Coalition finance minister Mathias Cormann suggests Australians keep an open mind to nuclear power, saying there isn't "anything inherently partisan" about the energy source.

title.children: Cormann urges open mind about nuclear power amid climate debate

image.altText: Larry Ellison sitting in a room at the White House

props.synopsis: The switch in the ranking comes after a blockbuster earnings report from Oracle, powered by multi-billion-dollar orders from customers as the AI race heats up.

title.children: Larry Ellison briefly overtakes Elon Musk as world's richest person

image.altText: Gout Gout of Queensland celebrates after winning a track race, yelling and raising his arms wide

props.synopsis: Usain Bolt delivers a simple piece of advice to Gout Gout as the Australian teenage sprint sensation prepares for his first world championships.

title.children: 'It's never just easy': Usain Bolt's message to Gout Gout ahead of world titles debut

image.altText: Sussan Ley in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Machinations over who will replace Liberal senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price on the Coalition frontbench are already underway, with the party's right warning it would be "incendiary" if the position was handed to someone from the left.

title.children: Senior liberals warn Ley against 'incendiary' frontbench replacement pick

image.altText: A side-on shot of Jacinta Nampijinpa Price speaking into microphones during a media conference outside, wearing a white jacket.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price attends a Liberal Party fundraiser in Perth, avoiding a sizeable media contingent who had gathered outside the event, a day after being axed from the shadow ministry.

title.children: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price attends fundraiser in Perth, avoids waiting media

image.altText: A young child stacks colourful Duplo blocks at a childcare centre. Other children stand next to them.

props.synopsis: Over 1 million files were found on the man's devices, with about 550,000 identified as unique images.

title.children: Sydney childcare worker charged with creating child abuse material

image.altText: Men in military camo with black balaclavas, green headbands and assault rifles stand in a line

props.synopsis: Since October 7, 2023 Hamas has lost its most senior leaders and military organisation, but two years in, it has preserved some capacity to keep fighting Israeli troops and remain the dominant force inside Gaza.

title.children: Israel's goal is to destroy Hamas. Here is what the group has left

image.altText: Marty Sheargold wearing headphones and speaking on air for Triple M, he has a bald head, greying moustache and beard.

props.synopsis: An Australian media regulator investigation finds radio presenter Marty Sheargold's comments on Triple M "demeaning" and "demonstrated a level of contempt and disdain for women's sport".

title.children: Sheargold's 'sexist' Matildas remarks breached decency rules

image.altText: Donald Trump and Charlie Kirk shake hands on stage

props.synopsis: Charlie Kirk rose from a teenage conservative campus activist to a top podcaster, culture warrior and ally of US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Who was Charlie Kirk, the conservative activist and Trump ally?

image.altText: Jess Fox in a screenshot from her Instagram story announcing she will miss the Canoe Slalom World Championships.

props.synopsis: For the first time since 2010, Australian Olympic gold medallist Jess Fox will miss the Canoe Slalom World Championships, being held later this month on her home course.

title.children: Jess Fox 'heartbroken' as she is forced to miss home world championships
